SENT.plain: Thirty-five cases of septic cavernous sinus thrombophlebitis seen over the past 5 years are reviewed
Of these 80% were secondary to infection of the medial 1/3rd of the face
In more than 2/3rds of the cases the infecting organism was Staphylococcus aureus
Even with appropriate antibiotic therapy the overall mortality was 34.3%
